Description of incident: VTech, a Hong Kong based company notified customers of a data breach when hackers were able to gain access to childrens' photos, chat logs, children's names, genders and birthdates, account email addresses, passwords, secret questions and answers for password retrieval, IP addresses, mailing addresses and download history.  "The majority of the people  hacked - more than 2.2 million parents and nearly 2.9 million kids - are  in the U.S. The hacks were spread across more than a dozen countries,  including France, the U.K. and Germany."More information: http://money.cnn.com/2015/11/30/technology/vtech-hack-kids/
